chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
dp_2xy: dio_polynomial nat nat -> dio_polynomial nat nat -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dp_x2y2: dio_polynomial nat nat -> dio_polynomial nat nat -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dp_2xy_size: forall u v : dio_polynomial nat nat, dp_size (dp_2xy u v) = 3 + dp_size u + dp_size v
dp_x2y2_size: forall u v : dio_polynomial nat nat, dp_size (dp_x2y2 u v) = 3 + 2 * dp_size u + 2 * dp_size v
dp_common: dio_elem_expr -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dp_common_size: forall e : dio_elem_expr, dp_size (dp_common e) <= 3
dp_eval_common: forall (φ ν : nat -> nat) (e : dio_elem_expr), dp_eval φ ν (dp_common e) = dee_eval φ ν e
dp_left: dio_constraint -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dp_right: dio_constraint -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dee2dp_1: list dio_constraint -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dee2dp_2: list dio_constraint -> dio_polynomial nat nat
dee2dp_1_size: forall l : list dio_constraint, dp_size (dee2dp_1 l) <= 1 + 8 * length l
dee2dp_2_size: forall l : list dio_constraint, dp_size (dee2dp_2 l) <= 1 + 12 * length l
dc_value_1: (nat -> nat) -> (nat -> nat) -> dio_constraint -> nat
dc_value_2: (nat -> nat) -> (nat -> nat) -> dio_constraint -> nat
ν: nat -> nat
φ: nat -> nat
l: list dio_constraint

Goal:
dp_eval φ ν (dee2dp_1 l) = fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 (map (dc_value_1 φ ν) l)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive dio_polynomial (V P : Set) : Set := dp_nat : nat -> dio_polynomial V P | dp_var : V -> dio_polynomial V P | dp_par : P -> dio_polynomial V P | dp_comp : dio_op -> dio_polynomial V P -> dio_polynomial V P -> dio_polynomial V P Arguments dio_polynomial (_ _)%type_scope Arguments dp_nat {V P}%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments dp_var {V P}%type_scope Arguments dp_par {V P}%type_scope Arguments dp_comp {V P}%type_scope
dp_eval : forall V P : Set, (V -> nat) -> (P -> nat) -> dio_polynomial V P -> nat
Inductive dio_elem_expr : Set := dee_nat : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_var : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_par : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_comp : dio_op -> nat -> nat -> dio_elem_expr Arguments dee_nat _%nat_scope Arguments dee_var _%nat_scope Arguments dee_par _%nat_scope Arguments dee_comp _ (_ _)%nat_scope
dio_constraint = (nat * dio_elem_expr)%type : Set
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow :
dp_size : forall V P : Set, dio_polynomial V P -> nat
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
dee_eval = fun (φ ν : nat -> nat) (e : dio_elem_expr) => match e with | dee_nat n => n | dee_var v => φ v | dee_par i => ν i | dee_comp o v w => de_op_sem o (φ v) (φ w) end : (nat -> nat) -> (nat -> nat) -> dio_elem_expr -> nat Arguments dee_eval (_ _)%function_scope
Module Init := Struct Definition Unconvertible : forall A : Type, A -> A -> Set. Definition unconvertible : forall (A : Type) (a b : A), Unconvertible A a b -> unit. End 
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
fold_right : forall A B : Type, (B -> A -> A) -> A -> list B -> A
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
BinNat.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNat.N.add (_ _)%N_scope

Build_dio_repr_at : forall (R : (nat -> nat) -> Prop) (a n l : nat) (ds_eqns : list dio_constraint) (ds_ref : nat), length ds_eqns = l -> (forall (x : nat) (c : dio_constraint), In c ds_eqns -> dc_vars c x -> a <= x < a + n) -> a <= ds_ref < a + n -> (forall ν : nat -> nat, exists φ : nat -> nat, Forall (dc_eval φ ν) ds_eqns) -> (forall ν : nat -> nat, R ν <-> (exists φ : nat -> nat, Forall (dc_eval φ ν) ds_eqns /\ φ ds_ref = 0)) -> dio_repr_at R a n l
dio_formula_elem : forall f : dio_formula, {l : list dio_constraint | length l <= 1 + 7 * df_size f /\ (forall (c : dio_constraint) (x : nat), In c l -> dc_vars c x -> x < 8 * df_size f) /\ (forall ν : nat -> nat, df_pred f ν <-> (exists φ : nat -> nat, Forall (dc_eval φ ν) l))}
